alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 8:11AM EDT until July 16 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Southwestern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Southeastern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 945 AM EDT. * At 811 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Easton, Bethlehem, Quakertown, Hellertown, Alpha, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Glendon, Pleasant Valley, Springtown, Phillipsburg, and Coopersburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 63 and 74. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. Northeast Extension between mile markers 44 and 49. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
